block.p: Molly Morse, the daughter of Linda and Edward Morse of New York, is to be married this evening to Rabbi Seth Limmer, the son of Shelley and Stephen Limmer of Great Neck, N.Y. Rabbi Robert N. Levine will officiate at the TriBeCa Rooftop in New York.

The bride, 27, is an antiquities specialist at Christie's, the auction house in New York. She graduated magna cum laude from Brown University and received a master's degree in art history from the Courtauld Institute of Art in London. Her father is the international market strategist for oil and gas futures at the Hess Energy Trading Company in New York. Her mother is executive vice president for products and services at GovWorks.com, an Internet company in New York.

Molly Morse, the daughter of Linda and Edward Morse of New York, is to be married this evening to Rabbi Seth Limmer, the son of Shelley and Stephen Limmer of Great Neck, N.Y. Rabbi Robert N. Levine will officiate at the TriBeCa Rooftop in New York.

The bride, 27, is an antiquities specialist at Christie's, the auction house in New York. She graduated magna cum laude from Brown University and received a master's degree in art history from the Courtauld Institute of Art in London. Her father is the international market strategist for oil and gas futures at the Hess Energy Trading Company in New York. Her mother is executive vice president for products and services at GovWorks.com, an Internet company in New York.

The bridegroom, also 27, graduated magna cum laude from Cornell University and in May was ordained at the Hebrew Union College-Jewish Institute of Religion. Next month he is to become a rabbi at Congregation B'nai Yisrael in Armonk, N.Y. His mother is the administrative director of the Central Conference of American Rabbis in New York and the president of Temple Beth-El of Great Neck. His father is a partner in Ackerman, Levine, Cullen & Brickman, a law firm in Great Neck.
